gurmukhi: psUAw mwnuK dyh AMqir AMqru iehY sbd suriq ko ibbyk Aibbyk hY
transliteration: Pasooaa Maanoukh Dayh Antari Antaru Ihai , Sabad Surati Ko Bibayk Abibayk Hai ?
translation: The only difference in human and animal body is that a human is aware of the union of consciousness and the holy word of the Guru but animal has no such knowledge nor any ability.

gurmukhi: psu hirhwau kihE suinE AnsuinE krY mwns jnm aupdys irdY tyk hY
transliteration: Pasu Harihaau Kahiao Souniao Anasouniao Karai , Maanas Janam Oupadays Ridai Tayk Hai ?
translation: If an animal is asked to stay away from green fields, or pasture land, it ignores it but a human being lodges the teachings of the True Guru in his heart and adheres to it.

gurmukhi: psUAw sbd hIn ijhbw n boil skY mwns jnm bolY bcn Anyk hY
transliteration: Pasooaa Sabad Heen Jihabaa N Boli Sakai , Maanas Janam Bolai Bachan Anayk Hai ?
translation: Devoid of words, an animal cannot speak with its tongue but a human can speak several words.

gurmukhi: sbd suriq suin smiJ bolY ibbykI nwqur Acyq psu pRyq hU mY eyk hY ]200]
transliteration: Sabad Surati Souni Samajhi Bolai Bibaykee , Naatur Achayt Pasu Prayt Hoo Mai Ayk Hai ?200?
translation: If a man listens, understands and speaks the words of Guru, he is a wise and intelligent person. Otherwise he too is one among the ignorant animal and a fool. (200)
